purpose.summary: Establish consistent guidelines for providing draws (advances against future commissions) and guarantees (minimum payment commitments) to ensure fair and consistent application, financial risk management, legal compliance, clear terms and documentation, and appropriate approval and oversight.

exclusions: Poor performers (does not solve performance issue)
Punishment avoidance (employee underperforming and requesting guarantee)

definitions.definition: An advance payment against future earned commissions. Employee receives advance which is reconciled against earned commissions.
examples: Recoverable Draw: Employee must repay if commissions don't cover (rare)
Non-Recoverable Draw: Employee keeps draw even if commissions don't cover (common)

definitions.definition: A minimum payment commitment for a specified period. Employee receives guaranteed amount regardless of performance with no repayment required. Typically time-limited (3-6 months).
examples: New Hire Guarantee: For new sales hires during ramp period
Performance Guarantee: During territory transition or plan changes
Market Guarantee: To attract/retain talent in competitive market

provisions.title: When Draws/Guarantees Are Appropriate
provisions.content: Guidelines for when draws and guarantees should be used based on specific business situations.

subProvisions.title: New Hire Situations
subProvisions.content: Typical Duration: 3-6 months. Typical Amount: 50-100% of target incentive.
items: Sales role with long sales cycle (>90 days)
New hire needs time to build pipeline
Territory is new or has limited existing pipeline
Competitive talent market requires guarantee to attract candidates

subProvisions.title: Territory Transition
subProvisions.content: Typical Duration: 1-3 months. Typical Amount: 50-75% of prior average earnings.
items: Major territory change mid-year
Territory significantly smaller than previous
Requires time to rebuild pipeline

subProvisions.title: Plan Change
subProvisions.content: Typical Duration: 1 quarter. Typical Amount: 75% of prior average earnings.
items: Significant plan redesign mid-year
New plan may result in short-term income disruption
Bridge payment to ensure smooth transition

subProvisions.title: Competitive Retention
subProvisions.content: Typical Duration: 3-12 months. Typical Amount: Varies based on market offer.
items: Top performer at risk of leaving
Competitive offer includes guarantee
Retain key talent during restructuring

provisions.title: Standard Terms & Conditions
provisions.content: Duration limits, amount limits, and recoverable vs. non-recoverable terms for draws and guarantees.

subProvisions.title: Duration Limits
subProvisions.content: Extension Beyond Maximum requires CFO approval and must document exceptional circumstances.

subProvisions.title: Amount Limits
subProvisions.content: New Hire Guarantee Maximum: 100% of target incentive. Recommended: 75% of target incentive for first 3 months, 50% for months 4-6. Draw Maximum: $10,000/month or 100% of target incentive (whichever is less). Exceptions: Executive or strategic roles may exceed limits with CFO approval.

subProvisions.title: Recoverable vs. Non-Recoverable
subProvisions.content: Company Standard: Non-Recoverable.
items: Simpler administration
Avoids wage law complications
More attractive to candidates
Lower legal risk
Recoverable Draw only if employee explicitly agrees in writing
Recoverable Draw subject to state wage law restrictions and requires Legal review

provisions.title: Draw Mechanics
provisions.content: How draws work, including monthly reconciliation and end-of-period transition.

subProvisions.title: How Draws Work
subProvisions.content: Employee receives draw amount each month. If earned commissions exceed draw, employee receives the higher amount. If earned commissions are less than draw, employee receives the draw amount (non-recoverable).

subProvisions.title: Draw Reconciliation
subProvisions.content: Monthly Reconciliation process and end of draw period transition.
items: Calculate earned commissions for the month
Compare to draw amount
Pay higher of: draw or earned commissions
Track cumulative draw vs. earned (for reporting, not recovery if non-recoverable)
End of Draw Period: Employee transitions to standard commission plan
No repayment required (if non-recoverable)
Final reconciliation statement provided

provisions.title: Guarantee Mechanics
provisions.content: How guarantees work: each month, employee receives the GREATER of the guarantee amount or earned commission.

subProvisions.title: How Guarantees Work
subProvisions.content: Each month, employee receives the GREATER of: Guarantee amount, OR Earned commission.

subProvisions.title: Guarantee vs. Earned Commission
subProvisions.content: Employee Always Receives Higher Amount. No 'Give Back' - once guarantee period ends, employee doesn't repay. Employee keeps all payments received.
items: If earned commission < guarantee: Paid guarantee
If earned commission > guarantee: Paid earned commission (employee does better than guarantee)

provisions.title: Approval Process
provisions.content: Approval authority and request process for draws and guarantees.

subProvisions.title: Request Process
subProvisions.content: Five-step process for requesting draws or guarantees. Timeline: Approval process should complete within 5 business days.
items: Step 1: Submit Request - Sales Manager submits Draw/Guarantee Request Form including business justification, amount, duration, candidate/employee info
Step 2: Review - Compensation team reviews request, verifies within policy limits, assesses precedent and consistency, recommends approval or denial
Step 3: Approval - Route to appropriate approver(s) per authority matrix, obtain signatures
Step 4: Documentation - Create written agreement, employee signs acknowledgment, file in employee file and ICMT
Step 5: Implementation - Set up draw/guarantee in ICMT, communicate to Payroll, begin payments

provisions.title: Written Agreement Requirements
provisions.content: All draw/guarantee agreements must include required elements and may require legal review.

subProvisions.title: Required Elements
subProvisions.content: All draw/guarantee agreements must include the following elements:
items: Employee Information: Name, ID, job title, start date
Amount: $ per month or total $
Duration: Start date, end date, # of months
Type: Draw (recoverable or non-recoverable) or Guarantee
Reconciliation: How earned commissions are reconciled
Termination Impact: What happens if employee leaves early
Transition: What happens when draw/guarantee period ends
Tax Treatment: Subject to normal tax withholding
Plan Participation: How this relates to standard incentive plan
Signatures: Employee and Company (authorized approver)

subProvisions.title: Legal Review
subProvisions.content: Legal review required for specific situations:
items: Recoverable draws (always)
Guarantees >$100,000 total
Executive guarantees (always)
Non-standard terms

provisions.title: Termination During Draw/Guarantee Period
provisions.content: Treatment of draws and guarantees when employment terminates during the active period.

subProvisions.title: Voluntary Resignation
subProvisions.content: Treatment varies by draw type.
items: Non-Recoverable Draw: Employee keeps all draw payments received, no repayment required, no further draw payments after termination date
Recoverable Draw: Employee may owe repayment of unearned portion, calculate earned commissions vs. total draw paid, consult Legal before pursuing collection
Guarantee: Guarantee payments stop at termination date, no further payments, employee keeps payments received to date

subProvisions.title: Involuntary Termination - Without Cause
subProvisions.content: Pro-rate guarantee for partial month. No further payments after termination. Employee keeps all prior payments.

subProvisions.title: Involuntary Termination - For Cause
subProvisions.content: Draw/guarantee payments stop immediately. No pro-ration. Company may seek recovery (if recoverable draw and misconduct inflated results). Consult Legal before withholding any payment.

provisions.title: Tax & Accounting Treatment
provisions.content: Draws and Guarantees are Taxable Compensation.

subProvisions.title: Tax Treatment
subProvisions.content: Draws and Guarantees are Taxable Compensation.
items: Subject to income tax withholding
Subject to FICA/Medicare
Reported on W-2
Typically supplemental wage rate (22% federal, varies by state)
Same as bonus/commission payments

subProvisions.title: Accounting Treatment
subProvisions.content: Consult Finance for specific accounting treatment.
items: Draws: Accrued as expense when paid; may create deferred asset if recoverable and recovery expected
Guarantees: Accrued as compensation expense over guarantee period; budgeted as part of sales compensation

provisions.title: Monitoring & Reporting
provisions.content: Active draw/guarantee tracking, quarterly reporting to CRB, and annual review requirements.

subProvisions.title: Active Draw/Guarantee Tracking
subProvisions.content: Compensation team maintains tracker with monthly review.
items: Verify all active draws/guarantees processed
Reconcile earned commissions vs. draw/guarantee
Flag upcoming expirations (30 days out)

subProvisions.title: Quarterly Reporting to CRB
subProvisions.content: Metrics and trends reported quarterly.
items: Number of active draws/guarantees
Total financial commitment ($ outstanding)
By type (new hire, territory, retention, etc.)
Approval rate (# requests vs. # approved)
Effectiveness (% of employees exceeding guarantee by end)
Trends: Are draws/guarantees increasing or decreasing?
Are they achieving intended purpose (retention, ramp success)?
Are limits being followed?

subProvisions.title: Annual Review
subProvisions.content: Assess Policy Effectiveness annually.
items: Success rate (% of new hires with guarantee who succeed long-term)
Cost vs. benefit (retention achieved vs. $ spent)
Policy compliance (were limits followed?)
Recommendations for policy updates

provisions.title: Ramping Schedules (Alternative to Guarantee)
provisions.content: Alternative to flat guarantee: Ramping quota. Achieves similar effect as guarantee (higher payout during ramp) without fixed guarantee payment.

provisions.title: State Law Considerations
provisions.content: Wage Laws Vary by State. This policy assumes non-recoverable draws/guarantees to minimize legal risk.

federalLaws: Federal income tax withholding (supplemental wage rate)
stateLaws: California: Advances and draws subject to specific rules
State wage law restrictions on recovery of draws
